text.headline: The Convening of the Dartmouth Conference
text.text: Artificial intelligence was officially declared born at the Dartmouth Conference as an independent discipline.

text.headline: Establishment of the World's First AI Laboratory
text.text: Carnegie Mellon University established the world's first laboratory dedicated to the research of artificial intelligence.

text.headline: Invention of the First Intelligent Chatbot, ELIZA
text.text: Joseph Weizenbaum invented the first intelligent chatbot, ELIZA.

text.headline: Introduction of the Knowledge Representation Language (KRL)
text.text: The American National Standards Institute introduced a new Knowledge Representation Language (KRL) for reasoning machines.

text.headline: Development of Expert Systems
text.text: Some expert systems emerged, with the most notable being MYCIN, which could be used in medical diagnostics.

text.headline: Deep Blue's Victory over Garry Kasparov
text.text: IBM's Deep Blue defeated Garry Kasparov, marking a significant breakthrough in the field of artificial intelligence.

text.headline: Google Introduces Statistical Learning-Based Speech Recognition
text.text: Google announced the release of statistical learning-based speech recognition technology, widely applied in voice assistants and smart homes.

text.headline: Watson's Triumph on the 'Jeopardy!' Show
text.text: In the television show 'Jeopardy!', IBM's computer Watson defeated two former champions, showcasing its understanding of natural language and knowledge.

text.headline: AlphaGo's Triumph over Go Champion Lee Sedol
text.text: AlphaGo defeated the Go champion Lee Sedol, demonstrating the potential of applying reinforcement learning techniques to artificial intelligence.

text.headline: Introduction of AlphaZero
text.text: DeepMind released AlphaZero, a robot capable of learning multiple board games without the need for human knowledge.

text.headline: Introduction of GPT-3
text.text: OpenAI released GPT-3, an extraordinary language model capable of generating articles indistinguishable from those written by humans.

text.headline: GPT-4 Release Announcement
text.text: In 2023, OpenAI officially releases GPT-4, the latest iteration of their powerful language model series. GPT-4 builds upon the success of its predecessors, showcasing even more advanced language understanding and generation capabilities.
